title: She's Gone
review: This is a gripping psychological thriller that keeps readers guessing until the very end. When college professor Nick Hansen's wife disappears, he delves into her mysterious past, uncovering dark secrets that threaten to unravel his life. With its fast-paced plot and well-developed characters, Bell crafts a riveting narrative filled with unexpected twists and turns

title: They Both Die at the End
review: This is a heart-wrenching tale that explores love, loss, and the meaning of life in the face of death. Set in a world where people receive a call on the day they're going to die, the story follows Mateo and Rufus, two strangers who connect through an app called Last Friend on their End Day. As they embark on a journey to live their last day to the fullest, their bond deepens, and they confront their fears and regrets. Silvera's poignant storytelling and authentic characters make 'They Both Die at the End' a profound and unforgettable read that will stay with readers long after they turn the final page.

title: Normal People
review: This is a compelling exploration of love and friendship between Connell and Marianne, two Irish teenagers from different backgrounds. Rooney's insightful writing delves into their complex relationship as they navigate the challenges of adulthood, class, and mental health. Through its raw portrayal of intimacy, the novel offers a poignant reflection on the dynamics that shape us.

title: The Best Way to Bury Your Husband
review: This is a darkly humorous and thought-provoking novel that takes readers on a wild ride through the absurdities of grief and redemption. When protagonist Jane's husband unexpectedly dies, she finds herself navigating the complexities of loss while dealing with a quirky cast of characters and unexpected twists. Casale's witty prose and sharp observations illuminate the absurdity of death and the human condition, offering a refreshing take on the mourning process. With its blend of dark humor and heartfelt moments, 'The Best Way to Bury Your Husband' is a captivating read that will leave readers pondering the meaning of life, death, and everything in between.
